thread.title: University of Illinois opens center for wounded veterans
thread.title_full: University of Illinois opens center for wounded veterans

title: University of Illinois opens center for wounded veterans
text:
University of Illinois opens center to help wounded war veterans earn college diplomas 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/3/15 1:09 pm EDT - Updated: 10/3/15 1:09 pm EDT 
URBANA, Illinois â€” The University of Illinois has opened a center to help wounded war veterans earn college diplomas. 
The Chez Family Foundation Center for Wounded Veterans in Higher Education opened Friday in Urbana. 
Gov. Bruce Rauner attended the ribbon-cutting along with donors, university officials and veterans. 
The (Champaign) News-Gazette reports ( http://bit.ly/1WDNoen ) that Rauner apologized for the difficult times faced by the university and other institutions because of the state government's budget impasse. 
The first-term Republican governor and the Democrat-dominated Legislature have failed to agree on a budget for the fiscal year that began on July 1. 
The presidents of the state's nine public universities, including Timothy Killeen of the University of Illinois, wrote a letter Thursday warning Rauner and legislative leaders that the schools were "on the brink of serious operational damage." 
Information from: The News-Gazette, http://www.news-gazette.com
